iptv-setup.title: IPTV Setup
iptv-setup.intro: Practical setup guides for IPTV apps, devices, playlists, and EPG. Use these posts when you need a clean, repeatable setup path or want to optimize a fresh install.

quickAnswer.question: What is the fastest way to set up IPTV correctly?
quickAnswer.answer: Pick a compatible player, add your M3U or Xtream login, attach the EPG URL, then tune buffer and playback settings for your device.
quickAnswer.highlight: Start with the device and player first - most setup issues come from mismatched apps.

streaming-guide.title: Streaming Guide
streaming-guide.intro: Deep streaming guides that explain how IPTV works, how to stabilize playback, and how to choose the right combination of app and device for your setup.

quickAnswer.question: What improves IPTV streaming quality the most?
quickAnswer.answer: A stable network (preferably wired), realistic bitrate settings, and a player tuned for your device make the biggest difference.
quickAnswer.highlight: Consistency beats raw speed when it comes to smooth IPTV playback.

iptv-tutorial.title: IPTV Tutorial
iptv-tutorial.intro: Hands-on tutorials focused on real tasks: configuring apps, fixing errors, and getting features like EPG, catch-up, or DVR working reliably.

quickAnswer.question: Which IPTV tutorials should I start with?
quickAnswer.answer: Start with the setup guide for your device, then follow the playlist + EPG tutorial to unlock the full channel guide experience.
quickAnswer.highlight: Setup + EPG = the two core tutorials for most IPTV users.

setup-guides.title: Setup Guides
setup-guides.intro: Step-by-step guides for setting up IPTV apps, playlists, EPG, VPNs, and devices. These are the most actionable posts for getting a working setup fast.

quickAnswer.question: What should I configure first when setting up IPTV?
quickAnswer.answer: Start with the player app and playlist login, then add EPG, then optimize buffer and playback settings.
quickAnswer.highlight: Most setup failures come from missing EPG or wrong playlist credentials.

player-comparisons.title: Player Comparisons
player-comparisons.intro: Side-by-side comparisons of popular IPTV players across devices, features, pricing, and real-world performance.

quickAnswer.question: How do I choose the best IPTV player?
quickAnswer.answer: Match the player to your device, then prioritize EPG support, stability, and the features you actually use.
quickAnswer.highlight: Compatibility and stability matter more than long feature lists.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.intro: Fix common IPTV problems such as login errors, buffering, and playback instability. These guides focus on diagnosing the root cause quickly.

quickAnswer.question: What is the fastest way to troubleshoot IPTV errors?
quickAnswer.answer: Test the stream in another player, verify credentials, then check network stability and buffer settings.
quickAnswer.highlight: If a stream fails in VLC too, the issue is likely the source or provider.
